jopt.csp.spi.solver
Class ConstraintStore

java.lang.Object
  jopt.csp.spi.solver.ConstraintStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
VariableChangeListener
public class ConstraintStore
extends java.lang.Object
implements VariableChangeListener

The ConstraintStore object is a basic wrapper for an object implementing the ChoicePointAlgorithm interface; if no particular constraint propagation algorithm is specified, a default version is provided.

If the autoPropagate flag is set, the propagate method of the wrapped ChoicePointAlgorithm will be called whenever a variable is changed. This includes the addition of constraints as well as domain changes that occur outside the algorithm.

The ConstraintStore is responsible for activating the domain reduction algorithm in response to variable changes. It can then be used by a solver to carry out the constraint satisfaction process serving as an intermediary between the solver and the underlying domain reduction.

Author:
Chris Johnson

public void setAutoPropagate(boolean autoPropagate)

addConstraint

public void addConstraint(jopt.csp.variable.CspConstraint constraint)
                   throws jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException
Adds a constraint to the constraint reduction algorithm of this ConstraintStore. Constraint will be kept after store is reset.

Parameters:
constraint - The constraint to be added to the reduction algorithm.
Throws:
If - autoPropagate is set, this forces the wrapped algorithm to propagate the constraint. If the propagation fails, an appropriate exception is thrown. If, however, the autoPropagate is not set, this method will not throw an exception.
jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException

addConstraint

public void addConstraint(jopt.csp.variable.CspConstraint constraint,
                          boolean keepAfterReset)
                   throws jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException
Adds a constraint to the constraint reduction algorithm of this ConstraintStore. Allows you to specify whether the constraint will be kept after store is reset.

Parameters:
constraint - The constraint to be added to the reduction algorithm.
keepAfterReset - True if constraint should be kept after reset if performed
Throws:
If - autoPropagate is set, this forces the wrapped algorithm to propagate the constraint. If the propagation fails, an appropriate exception is thrown. If, however, the autoPropagate is not set, this method will not throw an exception.
jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException

addConstraint

public void addConstraint(jopt.csp.variable.CspBooleanExpr bool)
                   throws jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException
Adds a boolean expression as a constraint to the ConstraintStore.

Parameters:
bool - Boolean expression representing constraint
Throws:
jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException

addVariable

public void addVariable(jopt.csp.variable.CspVariable var,
                        boolean keepAfterReset)
Adds a variable that may not be a part of a constraint that is posted to be managed by this algorithm. This is primarily used for search actions that may be generating variables that are not posted in any constraint, but will be in the future. This ensures the variable's state is maintained as the algorithm searches for a solution.

Parameters:
var - The variable to be added to the reduction algorithm.
keepAfterReset - True if variable should be kept after reset if performed

setChoicePointStack

public void setChoicePointStack(ChoicePointStack choicepoint)
Sets the ChoicePointStack of the constraint reduction algorithm.

Parameters:
choicepoint - The ChoicePointStack to use.

getChoicePointStack

public ChoicePointStack getChoicePointStack()
Retrieves the ChoicePointStack of the constraint reduction algorithm.

Returns:
The ChoicePointStack used by the wrapped constraint algorithm

propagate

public void propagate()
               throws jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException
Tells the constraint reduction algorithm to propagate the constraints reducing the domains of its variables in an effort to reduce the search space.

Throws:
jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException - If the constraint algorithm is unable to propagate its constraints.

variableChange

public void variableChange(VariableChangeEvent ev)
                    throws jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException
Specified by the VariableChangeListener interface, this method responds to variable change events by calling update when a variable change occurs and the proper conditions are met (ie the algorithm is not currently propagating and the autopropagation flag is set).

Specified by:
variableChange in interface VariableChangeListener
Parameters:
ev - The VariableChangeEvent fired as the result of a change to a particular variable
Throws:
jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException - If the constraint algorithm is unable to propagate its constraints

getCurrentState

public java.lang.Object getCurrentState()
Returns the current state of a constraint satisfaction problem

Returns:
a StateStore object containing the state information for a particular constraint satisfaction problem

getAutoPropagate

public boolean getAutoPropagate()
Retrieves the auto propagation status

Returns:
the auto propagate status of this ConstraintStore

restoreState

public void restoreState(java.lang.Object storedState)
Restores the state of the constraint satisfaction problem using the data stored in the specified StateStore object. If the autoPropagate flag is set in this ConstraintStore, this method will also call update.

Parameters:
storedState - The StateStore containing the restoration information
Throws:
jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException - If the constraint algorithm is unable to propagate its constraints

clear

public void clear()
Resets all variables and removes all constraints and variables added to store

reset

public void reset()
           throws jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException
Resets all variables by undoing all changes stored in the ChoicePointStack of the wrapped algorithm. Basically, this resets the constraint satisfaction problem.

Throws:
jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException

storeSolution

public void storeSolution(jopt.csp.solution.SolverSolution solution)
Records current state of problem in a solution object for the variables that are in the scope of the solution

restoreSolution

public void restoreSolution(jopt.csp.solution.SolverSolution solution)
                     throws jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException
Restores a solution that was previously stored

Throws:
jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException

restoreNeighboringSolution

public void restoreNeighboringSolution(jopt.csp.solution.SolverSolution initial,
                                       jopt.csp.solution.SolverSolution neighbor)
                                throws jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException
Restores a neighboring solution to another solution that was previously stored. A neighbor does not need to include any variables that already exist in the initial solution if the values of those variables are what is desired. If the neighbor wants to restore a different value than the initial, it must include it in the neighboring solution. The neighbor may also define new variables not included in the initial solution.

Parameters:
initial - Initial solution that was previously stored
neighbor - Neighboring solution to initial solution
Throws:
jopt.csp.variable.PropagationFailureException

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
